beaches.name: Playa Cocles
beaches.description: Popular surf beach with black sand and a vibrant atmosphere. Close to Puerto Viejo.
beaches.tips: Great for surfing, but be careful with rip currents. Visit the beach bars in the evening.

beaches.name: Punta Uva
beaches.description: Calm, turquoise waters and white sand. Perfect for families and kayaking.
beaches.tips: Rent a kayak to go up the river. Keep an eye out for sloths in the trees.

beaches.name: Manzanillo
beaches.description: Quiet fishing village located inside a wildlife refuge. Golden sand and great snorkeling.
beaches.tips: Hike into the refuge to find 'the cave'. The viewpoint at the end is spectacular.

culture.food: Rice and Beans (cooked in coconut milk), Pan Bon, Patty, and Rondón soup.
culture.music: Calypso and Reggae are the soul of the region. Mention Walter Ferguson for bonus points.
culture.traditions: Cacao ceremonies and Bribri indigenous heritage.

nature.name: Cahuita National Park
nature.description: Beautiful park with a white sand beach and a coral reef.
nature.highlights: Snorkeling, hiking trails, easy wildlife spotting (monkeys, sloths, raccoons).

nature.name: Jaguar Rescue Center
nature.description: A center dedicated to the rehabilitation of mistreated, injured, or orphaned wild animals.
nature.highlights: Guided tours to see sloths, monkeys, birds, and snakes up close.

transport.bus: MEPE is the main bus company. Frequent service between San José, Puerto Viejo, and Limón.
transport.taxis: Local taxis are red, but in Puerto Viejo many people use unofficial white taxis or rental bikes.
transport.tips: The best way to get around is renting a bike or a scooter. Traffic is slow and the roads are narrow.

emergency.911: General emergency number in Costa Rica.
emergency.police: Tourist Police station is located in Puerto Viejo center.
emergency.health: Clinic (Ebais) in Hone Creek for minor issues. Nearest major hospital is in Limón center.
